intro: Bupleurum koechelii f. eginense, commonly known as the Eginense bugloss, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. Its flowers are small, white to pale blue, and appear in clusters, blooming from June to August. This species is valued for its ornamental qualities and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
